<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/105781</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>105781</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770208867</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Egypt through the Stereoscope: Stereography and Virtual Travel</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Ägypten durch den Stereoscope: Stereography
und virtueller Spielraum</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">l'Egypte par le stereoscope : Stereography 
et voyage virtuel</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Egipto através do stereoscope: Stereography
e curso virtual</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">L'Egitto tramite lo stereoscope: 
Stereography e corsa virtuale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αίγυπτος μέσω του στερεοσκοπίου: Stereography
και εικονικό ταξίδι</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Egipto a través del estereoscopio: 
Stereography y recorrido virtual</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Examines how stereographs were used as a means of virtual travel. Focuses on James Henry Breasted's "Egypt through the Stereoscope" (1905, 1908). Provides context for resources in the Travelers in the Middle East Archive (TIMEA). Part 3 of a 4 part course called "History through the Stereoscope."</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Überprüft, wie stereographs als Mittel des 
virtuellen Spielraums benutzt wurden. Foki auf James Henry 
Breasteds "Ägypten durch den Stereoscope" (1905, 1908). Stellt 
Kontext für Betriebsmittel in den Reisenden im Mittlere Osten-Archiv zur 
Verfügung (TIMEA). Der Teil 3 eines Kurses mit 4 Teilen 
benannte "Geschichte durch den Stereoscope."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Examine comment des stereographs ont été 
utilisés en tant que des moyens de voyage virtuel. Foyers sur 
Egypte de Breasted d'Henry de James l'"par le stereoscope" 
(1905, 1908). Fournit le contexte pour des ressources dans les 
voyageurs dans les archives de le Moyen-Orient (TIMEA). La 
partie 3 d'un cours de 4 parts a appelé l'"histoire par le 
stereoscope."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Examina como os stereographs foram usados como 
meios do curso virtual. Focos Egipto de Breasted do Henry de 
James em "através do stereoscope" (1905, 1908). Fornece o 
contexto para recursos nos viajantes no arquivo de o Oriente Médio 
(TIMEA). A parte 3 de um curso de 4 porções chamou o "history 
através do stereoscope."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Esamina come gli stereographs sono stati usati 
come mezzi di corsa virtuale. Fuochi sull'Egitto del Breasted di
henry di James "tramite lo stereoscope" (1905, 1908). Fornisce 
il contesto per le risorse nei viaggiatori nell'archivio di Medio Oriente
(TIMEA). La parte 3 di un corso delle 4 parti ha chiamato "la 
storia tramite lo stereoscope."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Εξετάζει πώς stereographs χρησιμοποιήθηκε ως μέσο 
εικονικού ταξιδιού. Εστίαση james Henry Breasted's 
"Αίγυπτος μέσω του στερεοσκοπίου" (1905 ..1908). 
Παρέχει το πλαίσιο για τα στοιχεία συμπεριφοράς στους 
ταξιδιώτες στο αρχείο της Μέσης Ανατολής (TIMEA). Μέρος 
3 μιας αποκαλούμενης "σειρά μαθημάτων ιστορίας 4 μερών μέσω του 
στερεοσκοπίου."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Examina cómo los stereographs fueron utilizados 
como los medios del recorrido virtual. Focos en Egipto de 
Breasted del Henrio de James "a través del estereoscopio" (1905, 
1908). Proporciona al contexto para los recursos en las hojas de
ruta (traveler) en el archivo de el Oriente Medio (TIMEA). La 
parte 3 de un curso de 4 porciones llamó "historia a través del 
estereoscopio."</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>

              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>

END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>

            <entry>1770208867</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>

              <value>provider</value>
            </role>

          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>

            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>105781</entry>
